Just think: You could surround yourself with pieces by Finn Juhl, Hans Wegner, Nanna Ditzel, and others. (The no-name rooms are cool too.) Best of all, this friendly, genuine, centrally located hotel is one of this very pricey city’s more affordable options.THE VIBE IS: a living design museum but not too precious.WORD TO THE WISE: Be sure to borrow a bike from the hotel! It’s the best way to get around.PRACTICAL STUFF: Rooms start at $285.—Christine MuhlkeWE ALSO LOVENobis Hotel CopenhagenReally treat yourself at this luxe downtown district lodgingCafé Atelier SeptemberThe breezy Indre By café that’s turned avocado toast into an art formHotel SandersHygge it up at this cozy boutique hotel near Copenhagen’s Royal TheatreExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
